conclusion: Two particles, A and B, are placed on the same horizontal plane and start moving in a straight line simultaneously from rest, from the same position, and in the same direction.
The v-t (velocity-time) graph of their motion is shown in the figure.

Particle A has a triangular velocity profile: accelerates from 0 to 2v₀ during time 0 to t₀, maintains 2v₀ velocity from t₀ to 2t₀, decelerates from 2v₀ to 0 during time 2t₀ to 3t₀, and remains at rest after 3t₀.
Particle B has a trapezoidal velocity profile: accelerates from 0 to v₀ during time 0 to 3t₀, maintains v₀ velocity from 3t₀ to 5t₀, and decelerates from v₀ to 0 during time 5t₀ to 6t₀.

premise: The displacement is the area under the velocity-time curve.
